text: The molecular mechanisms underlying the <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> effect involve the upregulation of the DNA binding activity of NFAT ( 60 % ) and AP-1 ( 120 % ) , without affecting the activities of NFkappaB and CD28RC , which was confirmed by transfection assays .
We also show that the <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced enhancement of the AP-1 - DNA binding activity is not cyclosporin A - sensitive .

Since AP-1 is part of the NFAT complex , we conclude that the <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - signaling pathway is involved in the activation of the <extra_id_0> fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins of which AP-1 consists .
